{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3600128,"name":"Murilo Miranda Santos","username":"murilo404","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/49beb7/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T16:26:48.296Z","cooked":"

good morning! I am one programmer of a FRC team and i have questions of how to use the advantage scope. My team haven’t ideia if how to use. Someone can help me?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-04-22T16:26:48.296Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":136.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":500159,"topic_slug":"advantage-scope","display_username":"Murilo Miranda Santos","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69705,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/advantage-scope/500159/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3600188,"name":"Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)","username":"ngreen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ngreen/{size}/264478_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-22T16:59:46.377Z","cooked":"

I would first open it on your drive station computer while connected to the robot. Then use File > Connect to robot. If that doesn’t work right, you probably need to change the preferences, changing your IP to your team number 10.xx.yy.2 with xx.yy being your number.

When it connects, you can see what is currently logged on the left side menu. You can add different windows to the right with the + button in upper right. Mainly I like using the odometry (for pose values) and the line graphs for most everything (continous or discrete values). In those windows you can drag the various logged values from the left menu into the pages to populate them. There is a bunch more, but that is the basics.

For logging on the robot we currently use Epilogue and URCL. Both are relatively easy to set up, and also to generate log files that you can view after matches. We use a USB drive in the RoboRIO to have plenty of storage to save these. You can start Epilogue in Robot.java, and then just have to add @Logged before each class declaration in the other subsystem files. You may need to add some getters to record all the values you might want. Again there is more you can do, but this will get you started.

thaks for help me. I tryed use the XR of advantage scope with the QR code. Have someone diference or is the same ?

The best place to start is https://docs.advantagescope.org/ and particularly the Getting Started page.

  • The Managing Log Files page under that links off to WPILib and other resources to help you log data that AdvantageScope can view.
  • Connecting to Live Sources will get you started with live data viewing.
murilo404:

I tryed use the XR of advantage scope with the QR code.

You should start with the basic application. AdvantageScope XR is a new (and still somewhat experimental) feature that provides a set of augmented-reality visualization tools. While very exciting, it requires the same log data needed for 3D field viewing, so this is only useful if you’ve already mastered the basics of logging and working with robot data.
